The facility has a system of controls in place to prevent the catastrophic release of a regulated substance.  These systems include process controls, mitigation systems, and monitoring/detection systems.  

American Craft Brewery, LLC also has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees are competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes.  The training program consists of both classroom and on the job training.  

The facility carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operation.  Any equipment deficiencies identified by maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

American Craft Brewery, LLC has also implemented a compliance audit program to determine whether the provisions set out under the PSM standard and RMP rule are being implemented.  Corrective actions resulting from these audits are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner.

The facility investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in catastrophic release of a regulated substance.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident, as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.  

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

The ammonia system has not had an accident in the past five years resulting in any of the 40 CFR 68.10(b)(1) listed consequences (death, injury, environmental restoration).

SAMUEL ADAMS BREWERY COMPANY, LTD.
CINCINNATI, OHIO

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

American Craft Brewery, LLC is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive Accidental Release Prevention Program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the Anhydrous Ammonia Refrigeration System process at our facility.

If a release occurs, we have coordinated Emergency Response procedures with the Cincinnati Fire Department which provides highly trained emergency response personnel to control and mitigate the effects of the release of ammonia.

OUR FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED

American Craft Brewery, LLC uses Anhydrous Ammonia as a refrigerant for cooling storage rooms, water, and beer in its operation at 1625 Central Parkway. The Ammonia Refrigeration System consists of a main ammonia receiver tank, eight heat exchangers, twenty-five evaporators, one ammonia vapor accumulator, twelve compressors, and three evaporative condensers.  The facility only has one (1) regulated substance: Anhydrous Ammonia.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMCAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

American Craft Brewery, LLC complies with all applicable federal and state codes and regulations.  

The facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with processes are identified and controlled efficiently.  These studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering maintenance, and process operations that are revalidated at regular intervals.  Any findings related to hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.
